subject: Re: [junit] Learning JUnit
msgSnippet: ... Fit really deserves to be a separate course, and doesn t really fit in here. I think it really needs to be a hands on course. Less is probably more. You
messageBody:
Vijay wrote:
> I am designing a course on Test Driven Development. I need help
> regarding the contents of this course.
>
> The proposed details of the course are
>
> Prerequiste: Core Java
>
> Duration of the course: 1 day
>
> Contents:
>
> * Using JUnit
> * Mock objects with JMock
> * Using DBUnit
> * Using Fit for acceptance/system testing
> * Eclipse plugin for JUnit
>

Fit really deserves to be a separate course, and doesn't really "fit" in
here. I think it really needs to be a hands on course. Less is probably
more. You might well not get to DBUnit either.

--
